TechJam ‚Äî Retrieval-Augmented Governance & Law Assistant

This project demonstrates how to build a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) application that can answer compliance and governance questions across multiple legal sources (e.g., EU regulations, California/Florida state bills, US federal code). It leverages LangChain, LangGraph, and Azure OpenAI to load, clean, chunk, and index text from bills, then retrieve and ground LLM responses in actual law text.

üìñ Features

Multi-source ingestion: Loads multiple legal texts (webpages, PDFs, code).

Cleaning & chunking: Normalizes text and splits into overlapping chunks for better semantic retrieval.

Vector store indexing: Embeds chunks into an in-memory vector store (can swap for Pinecone/Qdrant/etc.).

RAG pipeline: Retrieves top-k relevant law sections and passes them to an LLM.

LangGraph orchestration: Defines a retrieval ‚Üí generation workflow with conversational state support.

Citations & abstention: The assistant only answers from context; if unknown, it replies ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know based on the provided information‚Äù.
